intro: Linanthus liniflorus subsp. pharnaceoides, commonly known as the pharnaceoides linanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its structure includes slender, branched stems and small, elliptical leaves. It produces capsules as fruits, which contain numerous tiny seeds.
